channel.title: The Moscow Times - Independent News From Russia
channel.description: The Moscow Times offers everything you need to know about Russia: Breaking news, top stories, business, analysis, opinion, multimedia, upcoming cultural events

item.title: Russia Imposes Biometric, Drug Screening for Foreigners
item.description: Foreigners coming to Russia for periods longer than three months will have to submit their fingerprints and other biometric data.

item.title: Skepticism to Acceptance: How Putin's Views on Climate Change Evolved Over the Years
item.description: Despite eventually accepting that climate change is a threat, Putin is still reluctant to support drastic economic changes recommended by the UN.

item.title: Russia Posts Record Covid Deaths for Third Day Running
item.description: The daily death toll of 672 released Thursday topped Wednesday's record of 669 and Tuesday's of 652.

item.title: Russia Races Tom Cruise and Musk for First Movie in Space
item.description: One of Russia's most celebrated actresses, Yulia Peresild, is blasting off to the ISS with film director Klim Shipenko in October.

item.title: Russia Tags 4 Khodorkovsky-Linked NGOs ‘Undesirable’
item.description: Another “undesirable” Khodorkovsky group, Open Russia, disbanded in May to avoid jail sentences for supporters.

item.title: Coronavirus in Russia: The Latest News | July 1
item.description: Record-setting deaths. Moscow cases soar. Mandatory vaccination.

item.title: Putin's Phone-In Hit by 'Cyberattacks'
item.description: This year's phone-in repeatedly faced connection problems, particularly during calls from remote regions.

item.title: Putin Says Ukraine Is Controlled by Western Leaders
item.description: An adviser to Ukrainian President Zelenskiy's chief of staff dismissed Putin's claims as a "basic element of Russian propaganda."

item.title: Russia Hands Out Longest Jail Terms Yet to Jehovah’s Witnesses
item.description: Two members of the religious denomination labeled “extremist” in 2017 have been sentenced to seven and eight years.

item.title: Putin Reveals He Took Russia’s Sputnik V Coronavirus Vaccine
item.description: The Kremlin previously said it would keep the name of the Russian-made vaccine that Putin received this spring a “secret.”

item.title: Putin Takes Russians' Questions at Annual Marathon Call-In
item.description: This year’s event focused heavily domestic issues including Covid-19 vaccination efforts and rising food prices.

item.title: Russia Launches Cargo Ship to Space Station
item.description: Russian space freighter is scheduled to dock with the International Space Station on Friday, bringing 420 liters of water and other supplies to Earth's orbit.

item.title: Guatemala Seeks Refund from Russia Over Delayed Vaccine Doses – Reports
item.description: The Latin American country has only received 150,000 Sputnik V doses out of the 8 million it purchased.

item.title: Russia Wields S-400 Missile Systems in Response to U.S.-Led Black Sea Drills
item.description: Ukraine and 32 NATO members are carrying out the Sea Breeze 2021 drills involving 5,000 military personnel, 40 aircraft and 32 warships.

item.title: Russia Approves Roster of Neutral Athletes for Tokyo 2020
item.description: Russia is banned from international competitions for two years over doping violations.

item.title: U.S., Russia at Odds as UN Council Confronts Threat of Cyberattacks
item.description: The U.S. envoy asked that member states respect a cybersecurity framework already in place, while her Russian counterpart called for a new treaty.

item.title: Dutch Say Russian Jets Buzzed Warship in Black Sea
item.description: The incident last Thursday involved the frigate HNMLS Evertsen.

item.title: Germany Bans Travel From Russia, Citing Coronavirus Variant Spread
item.description: The announcement came as Russia grapples with a third wave fueled by the highly contagious Delta variant and slow vaccination uptake.

item.title: Russia Confirms First Delta Plus Variant Cases
item.description: Delta Plus is a variant of the highly contagious Delta variant first detected in India that accounts for 90% of Moscow’s new Covid-19 cases.

item.title: Demand Finally Outstrips Supply in Russia’s Vaccination Race
item.description: As mandatory vaccination programs kick-start a sluggish jab campaign, the country’s regions are facing shortages.

item.title: Russia Won't Hit 60% Vaccination Target By Autumn, Kremlin Says as Virus Surges
item.description: Russia's goal of reaching herd immunity through vaccination has been delayed by a lagging public uptake.

item.title: Moscow's QR Code System for Restaurant Access, Explained
item.description: Many Muscovites have expressed confusion with the city's new rules requiring restaurant patrons to show proof of vaccination or immunity.

item.title: Russia Breaks Daily Coronavirus Fatality Record
item.description: Tuesday's record beats the previous mortality record set at the height of Russia’s second wave on Dec. 24.

item.title: Russian Journalists Investigating Top Cop’s Wealth Raided, Detained
item.description: The raids may stem from a criminal libel investigation over Proekt's 2017 report linking Putin to a businessman suspected of mafia connections.

item.title: Western Schools Teach Children That Jesus Was Bisexual, Russian Foreign Minister Says
item.description: Russian observers speculated that Lavrov’s critique of the West was aimed at drumming domestic support ahead of key parliamentary elections.

item.title: Czech Republic Asks Russia to Pay for 2014 Arms Blast
item.description: Prague blames Russian military intelligence for the deadly 2014 explosion at an ammunition depot on its soil.

item.title: Russia, China Extend Treaty, Hail Ties
item.description: The past several years have marked a period of intensified cooperation for Moscow and Beijing.

item.title: St. Petersburg Celebrates 'Scarlet Sails' Despite Coronavirus Surge
item.description: St. Petersburg held its annual "Scarlet Sails" celebration for high school grads despite record coronavirus cases.

item.title: How Will Moscow’s Mandatory Vaccination Drive Work?
item.description: The Russian capital is rolling out one of the broadest mandatory vaccination programs in the world.

item.title: Lukashenko Rival Maintains Innocence as He Faces Jail
item.description: "I am not ashamed in front of my family and friends," Viktor Babaryko said to applause in the courtroom.

item.title: St. Petersburg Euro 2020 Quarter-Final to Go Ahead Despite Covid Surge – Organizers
item.description: The city has seen a surging outbreak due to the highly transmissible Delta variant first identified in India.

item.title: Moscow, St. Petersburg Report Record Daily Coronavirus Death Tolls
item.description: Just 14.9% of Russia's population has been vaccinated with at least one dose due to widespread skepticism.

item.title: U.S. Embassy in Moscow to Halt Visa, Consular Services From Aug. 1
item.description: Russia banned the embassy from employing foreign nationals when it designated the U.S. as an “unfriendly” country.

item.title: News From Russia: What You Missed Over the Weekend
item.description: Delta spread. U.S. visa services suspended. Vaccine shortages.

item.title: St. Petersburg Posts Record Covid Toll Following Euro 2020
item.description: Russia has seen an explosion of new coronavirus cases since mid-June.

item.title: Russian Vaccine Skeptics Rush to Buy Fake Covid Jab Certificates
item.description: Dozens of dealers claim to sell fake certificates and even falsified registration on the government vaccination database.

item.title: Jailed Belarus Activist, Girlfriend Moved to House Arrest
item.description: Belarusian opposition leader Svetlana Tikhanovskya described the move as "good news" but said the pair is "still being held hostage."

item.title: Russia Investigating Reports of Delta Plus Virus Variant Emergence – Watchdog
item.description: Some 200 cases of Delta Plus have been confirmed in 11 countries including the U.S. and Britain.

item.title: U.S., Western Embassies Fly Gay Pride Flags in Moscow
item.description: The Kremlin last June decried the rainbow flag displays on embassy buildings as illegal under Russian law.

item.title: Kremlin 'Regrets' EU Rejection of Proposed Putin Summit
item.description: "President Putin was and remains interested in establishing working relations between Moscow and Brussels," the Kremlin said.

item.title: ‘I’m Ready to Go to Prison’: The 26-Year-Old Taking On Russia’s Ruling Party
item.description: Roman Yuneman is counting on a mix of nationalism and local activism to win a State Duma seat from United Russia.

item.title: Russian Opposition Deputy Barred From Moscow Elections Over Navalny Support
item.description: “I have not seen such impudent lawlessness in a long time,” Ilya Yashin tweeted.

item.title: Russia Deploys 'Invincible' Kinzhal Hypersonic Missile-Capable Jets for Syria War Games
item.description: The MiG-31Ks joined other warplanes and submarines in the eastern Mediterranean Sea amid U.S. and British presence in the region.

item.title: EU Leaders Rebuff German-French Push for Putin Summit
item.description: Berlin and Paris blindsided EU counterparts by putting forward a last-minute proposal for the bloc to resume meetings with Putin.

item.title: Finnish Football Fans Bring Virus Back From Russia
item.description: Thousands of Finnish fans traveled to Russia to support their team in the Euro 2020 championships.

item.title: Russian Military Helicopter Crash Kills 3
item.description: The Mi-8, which belonged to the Russian National Guard, went down "following an air incident" on a training flight.

item.title: U.S. Ambassador Sullivan Returns to Moscow Following Putin-Biden Summit
item.description: Sullivan and his Russian counterpart were recalled to their respective countries after Biden described Putin as a “killer.”

item.title: Russia’s Record-Breaking Heatwave to Continue Into July – Weather Service
item.description: Heat records are being broken on a daily basis as European and Far Eastern Russia suffer from extreme summer temperatures.

item.title: Russia’s Southern Resorts to Close to Unvaccinated Tourists
item.description: From Aug. 1, the Krasnodar region’s sanatoriums, hotels and summer camps in cities like Sochi will only welcome vaccinated tourists.

item.title: UK's PM Hits Back at Russian 'Bear' in Warship Row
item.description: "It was entirely right that we should vindicate the law and pursue freedom of navigation in the way that we did," Johnson said.
